alert.note: Alert for Burlington; Middlesex; Monmouth; Ocean (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued September 08 at 2:30PM EDT until September 08 at 3:15PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Ocean County in southern New Jersey... Northeastern Burlington County in southern New Jersey... Monmouth County in central New Jersey... Southeastern Middlesex County in northern New Jersey... * Until 315 PM EDT. * At 230 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near West Freehold to Freewood Acres to near Browns Mills, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Wind damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. * Locations impacted include... Toms River, Lakewood, Old Bridge, Jackson, Howell, Marlboro, Manalapan, Tinton Falls, Holmdel, Red Bank, Jamesburg, Lakehurst, Farmingdale, Roosevelt, East Freehold, Six Flags Theme Park, West Freehold, Cassville, Adelphia and Clarksburg. This includes the following highways... Interstate 195 in New Jersey between mile markers 14 and 34. Garden State Parkway between mile markers 97 and 111. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. In addition to large hail and damaging winds, frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
